Habituation, lack of reminders, presence of hard cash, different goals, lack of understanding of the actual attack scenarios
We got clearance from the ethics commision/IRB and legal teams
Acquiring consent Would have influenced the measurement Muphy and Dingwall (2007): if people are in the public space they give implicit consent to be seen
Deception Not really an issue: covert non-participant
Privacy PIN entry is sensitive action All locations were chosen so the observer could not see the entered PIN
Anonymity We did not collect any personal data on the observed subjects
